ovdesc.p: Drawings is an application under the Letter of Credit system that is used to effect the transfer of funds and the acceptance of documents under Letters of Credit and Documentary Collection transaction. The system is fully integrated within T24 to provide Accounting, Limit Exposure, Position Updating, Control and actual administration of L/C Collection activity together with ensuring efficient delivery of the related Advices, Documents, Covering Letters, and Payments.
In order to enter a drawing, the Letter of Credit Collection parent contract must first be set up in order to define the types of drawings that can be made.
The main type of transactions that the system processes are as follows:
Acceptance of Documents (AC)

After checking that the documents presented comply with the terms and conditions of the LC, the bank will accept a bill of exchange on behalf of the beneficiary, which can then be discounted by the bank. This is a term or usance type drawing.
Deferred Payment (DP)

After checking that the documents presented comply with the terms and conditions of the LC, an undertaking is given by the Bank for payment to be made at a future date. This type can be discounted by the bank in order to effect payment to the beneficiary at an earlier date, although reimbursement will not be received by the bank until the aforementioned future date.
Sight Payment (SP)

After checking that the documents presented comply with the terms and conditions of the LC, immediate payment is effected to the Beneficiary/ Collecting Bank and reimbursement obtained from applicant/opening bank.
Collections for L/C (CO)

If there are any discrepancies in the documents presented for payment/ acceptance, they can be handled on a collection basis whereby the Documents are presented to the LC application for their authorisation to pay/accept.
Collection Chase for L/C or D/C (CC)

Used to chase drawings that have been sent for collection. Currently this will be performed manually by entering a change to the existing drawing type (from CO to CC), but a facility exists to automate this so that collection chases will be produced on a fixed date specified for the drawing.
Collection rejection for L/C or D/C (CR)
Used to signify that a drawing sent for collection has been rejected by the applicant or issuing bank. If payment had been made under reserve, then funds will be claimed back from the Beneficiary.
Document Checking (DC)
Registration of Documents (RD)
The main features of the application can be described as follows:
1. Input Processing

A stringent validation process is performed in order to ensure the correctness of any transaction input. Which includes cross check with the parent L/C contract to enforce any restrictions imposed. All inputs as applicable, will update limits, positions, accounts, etc. in real time. After authorization of the deal, all the documents, advices, covering letters, and S.W.I.F.T. messages applicable for the deal will be automatically generated by the Electronic Delivery System.

The account to debit can be in a different currency to that of the LC. In this case the system will automatically calculate the foreign exchange necessary using current mid market buy and sell rates plus customer spread rates. This exchange rate can be overridden by entering a specific rate to be used.
The drawings entered will also update statistics held on the parent L/C record to show drawings outstanding, collections outstanding, total amount discounted etc.
2. Charge Processing

Default charges for all types of Drawing can be entered via the LC.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION file, and will be automatically calculated by the system. The facility to add extra charges or amend charges is available, together with the facility to waive all charges. All charge entries are automatically generated, and if specified in a foreign currency, positions will be updated accordingly. Charges can be amortised over the life of the contract, at frequencies defined by the user.

Charges can be claimed from a number of parties involved in the Letter of Credit or Documentary Collection. It is important to note that charges can be denominated in a currency other than the Letter of Credit/ Documentary Collection Currency.

Whenever a sight drawing is entered that will effect a payment or claim reimbursement, the system will automatically deduct the outstanding charges from the payment amount, or add the total charges to the reimbursement amount, as indicated in the relevant charges fields.

With regards to Acceptance/Deferred Payment drawings, charges will be taken at the first maturity, which may not necessarily be relative to the first acceptance of documents. LC requests drafts at 120 days after Bill of Lading date
e.g. 1st drawing payable 20.12.93 2nd drawing could be payable 18.12.93
All outstanding charges will therefore be taken 18.12.93
3. Document Processing

All documents required to be produced by the input of the transaction will be generated by the Electronic Delivery System in order to facilitate easy amendment and customisation of the forms. Large amounts of text can be entered using the WordPerfect application, and then linked into the L/C documents by simply entering the file name of the WordPerfect ASCII file into the field provided on the screen.
Frequently used text and clauses can be entered via the LC.ADVICE.TEXT and LC.CLAUSES applications, and then linked into the transaction by entering a short code into the fields provided.
The word processing system presently used is WordPerfect, but any other package can easily be incorporated into the system.
4. Inquiries and Reports
In common with other T24 Applications all data can be enquired upon or selectively analyzed and researched. The system will also automatically produce reports of Collections Due, Unpaid Charges, etc.

This field identifies the manner in which overdue payments are handled. The default for all contracts is AUTOMATIC.

If PARTY.CHARGED were to be CO or CB, this field would be defaulted with DRAWDOWN.ACCOUNT or PAYMENT.ACCOUNT respectively. However in this case, say an Export payment of GBP 100,000 is to be realized from a GBP Nostro to into a Customer's account in Local currency (other than GBP, say USD) and realization happens for GBP 99,200.00, the PARTY.CHARGED code would be used as CB and the account defaulted would be Customer's USD account. But if GBP undergoes a rate change prior to maturity of this Drawing, the settlement amount may not happen for GBP 99,800 but for a small +/- amount depending on the movement of the rate, creating an inconsistency in the Nostro account.

In order to eliminate this, when the PARTY.CHARGED is either CO or CB, the User can manually override the Defaulted account, with that of other, i.e., for CO with PAYMENT.ACCOUNT and for CB with DRAWDOWN.ACCOUNT.
For further details see help text under field PARTY.CHARGED.

This code identifies which kind of Drawing is being made under the L/C, and will impact the kind of processing done. The following types can be entered for a new drawing:

Draw type can be changed to SP, AC or DP only.

For Drawing types of 'AC' and 'DP', a term or usance credit is established whereby the funds will be debited and paid on the MATURITY.REVIEW date specified later. If the funds are required to be paid before this date, the Drawing can be Discounted, whereby payment is made on the Value date specified, but reimbursement is obtained on the MATURITY.REVIEW date.
If 'SP' is entered, then both Payment and reimbursement is made on the VALUE.DATE specified.

For 'AC' and 'DP' type drawings, once the maturity review date is reached and the drawing undergoes maturity processing, then the Drawing type will automatically change to 'MA' (From 'AC'), and 'MD' (From 'DP'), indicating that these deals are now matured. However, it is to be noted that for Export Usance Drawing to Mature automatically, either the CONFIRM.INST in LC should hold the value as CONFIRM or the Drawing must have been discounted. In absence of either of these the Drawing has to be manually matured. In the case of Import Usance Drawing is maturity is always automatic with an option for the user to manually mature the same.
If an authorised 'CO' is changed to a 'CC', then the system will perform chasing logic (ie. produce chase advices), and the reset the drawing type back to its original value, once authorised.

When a drawing type of RP is used for an Export LC, this will generate a message (MT754) acknowledging documents were presented in accordance with the terms and conditions of the underlying credit and also a claim for reimbursement (MT742). Alternatively, an Import LC will generate the release of a payment, to the beneficiary, in the form of a Customer Transfer (MT100).

A Final Rejection (FR) is normally used when the Sender considers the documents, not to be in accordance with the terms and conditions of the credit, and consequently, refuses them. The difference between drawing type FR and CR is that using type CR will generate a message denoting advice of refusal (MT734) and FR will only ever generate a letter denoting Advice of Refusal/Rejection (1734). Note that this drawing type may only be used following a Collection Rejection (CR).
Amendment to Drawing (AD) is permitted to facilitate messaging activity by enabling to alter text and/or local fields.

In the event that the user confirms the override, the full text of the actual override message will be stored, for reference purposes only, in this multivalue field.

blank - The charge has not been taken yet

2 - The charge has been taken
3 - The charge has been claimed
4 - A claimed charge has been settled
7 - Charge Unpaid Reversed
8 - Charge has been taken by adding the amount to a reimbursement claim via a drawing.
9 - Charge has been taken by deducting the amount from a payment via a drawing.
11 - Charge will be taken by deducting the amount from a payment (status 9) at maturity
12 - Charge will be taken by adding the amount to a reimbursement claim (status 8) at maturity
15 - The charge has been waived.

When the charge is paid the operator will manually access the LC.ACCOUNT.BALANCES file, where all the charge details are recorded after authorization of the L/C, update the file to indicate that the payment has been received, and the CRF Claimed bucket reimbursed.

(ii) When a drawing is entered whereby payments are made or reimbursement is required, then the charge amount will be either deducted from the payment amount or added to the reimbursement amount in order to make a profit and loss entry. The charge status that was initially blank will change as applicable to charge status 8 or 9.

This field holds the activity number, which is triggered by the latest activity in the life-cycle of the transaction.. The activity is 4 digit number composed of three main parts:
First indicates the operation
1 - Represents O or P operation in LETTER.OF.CREDIT
2 - Represents A, C or T operation in LETTER.OF.CREDIT
3 - Represents Sight Drawing Operation in DRAWINGS
4 - Represents Usance Drawing Operation in DRAWINGS
Second indicates the type of instrument
1 - Represents Outward Collection
2 - Represents Inward Collection
4 - Represents Export Letter of Credit
8 - Represents Import Letter of Credit
And the last two digit indicate the detail activity related to that operation.

For example. : For the L/C Export Sight Payment activity, the first digit will be 3. The second digit will be 4 and the last two digits will be 01; (to indicate basic INPUT/AUTHORIZE operation).
